title: I don't want warwick to have a skillshot
body:
Please for the love of god don't turn his Q into a skillshot

Is there really anything more disheartening than listening to riot tell you the champ you play needs more micro cause?, if I wanted to to play yasuo or riven or some other :O mechancix OUTPLAYEDOUTPLAYEDOTOETEOTRAORDSOAFSDAF champ I'd play them, why is "well I think he's boring" a reason to rework a champion.  It's basically telling everyone who currently plays ww to go fuck yourself you stupid fuck.

replies.body: Honestly it would be cooler if WW just had his R broken up into multiple jumps so you could go BAMF BAMF BAMF POUNCE POUNCE POUNCE RAWR through their team and scream I AM FURRY YASUO BITCHES.

Why are you concerned?
I don't see anything that indicates that this would be a possibility.
Why am I concerned?  Cause I enjoy playing warwick as he is now.  I'm not interested in having a champ I enjoy playing being effectively deleted from the game, like old Sion or old Poppy.

> [{quoted}](name=Brandon Heat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GgVOEtJ4,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-09-01T00:10:24.394+0000)
>
> Why am I concerned?  Cause I enjoy playing warwick we he is now.  I'm not interested in having a champ I enjoy playing being effectively deleted from the game, like old Sion or old Poppy.

I don't think enough people share your sentiments. Most people agree he's too simple to play and isn't enjoyable to play as or against. Hell, Old Taric was more interesting than WW and he got reworked.

Why does it matter if other ppl don't share my sentiments.  Other ppl can play other champs, or riot can release new champs to cater to these people, it makes no change an existing champ when said champ isn't even OP.

> [{quoted}](name=Brandon Heat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=GgVOEtJ4,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-01T00:20:04.112+0000)
>
> Why does it matter if other ppl don't share my sentiments.  Other ppl can play other champs, or riot can release new champs to cater to these people, it makes no change an existing champ when said champ isn't even OP.

Because unless you're like buddies with Riot's CEO, one user's opinion over everyone elses doesn't hold much weight. They're not going to keep one champion dumbed down so a small minority can continue to enjoy playing him. His ult is cancer to play against even if the champion itself is balanced.

Yasuo's entire kit isn't cancer right.  Getting hit by an ult that does next to no damage and stuns for less than 2 seconds, can't have that, gotta be able to micro your way outta everything then jerk off afterwards from your sick montage right.

Aside from being unfun, Warwick is just a pathetically weak champion. He's essentially a watered down Malphite where he can be really tanky but isn't really worth anything aside from his ult. He also lacks any kind of skill ceiling. He's braindead to play and you've pretty much mastered in him 5 games. There's really nothing else you can do with him beyond that.

Riot are wanting to raise his skill ceiling while keeping his kit super simple still, much like Annie where she's mechanically simple, but there's a real difference between a mechanically skilled Annie and someone who isn't.

Warwick was the first champion I ranked to 5 back when the ranks only went up to 5, and when I stopped playing him, I found many different champions mechanically more fun. Honestly, from a business standpoint, Riot can make much more money by making Warwick more fun. I'm excited for a Warwick rework, especially since I know Riot won't completely remove what he used to be. When they reworked Taric, they left the stun and heal, but added so much more. They made the stun much more rewarding to hit, and the heal requires more skill to use. The upcoming Yorick rework keeps his ghouls, his ability to zone out enemies and his splitpushing power, but retools his kit completely to be tons more fun.
